title: Delete annex files of past commits + other questions

labels.name: question
labels.description: Issue asks a question rather than reporting a problem

labels.name: answered
labels.description: An answer to a question-type issue was provided

body:
#### What is the problem?
A few questions as we learn more how to use datalad:
1. How do I delete annex files from ALL past commits? Yes, I know that I can't roll back to earlier commits anymore, but I don't need to keep around old file versions that are corrupt.
2. Related to the first but more specific. I plan to distribute the data every once in a while, and I plan to mark version tag the released commit so we know exactly at which points we gave the data out. Thus, I need to keep annex content of some (tagged) commits so I can roll back as needed if someone asks for that specific version of the data. But I do not need (or like) to keep file content for commits between the released commits. Is there a way to drop all content linked to commits between two commits A and B?
3. It is still unclear to me what happens when I install a dataset from somewhere and get the files? Does the `get` command get all the content even from past commits, or just the current one? I am asking because I will need to just distribute a version of the data from a specific commit, not all past annex content.


#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
NA

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
0.12.2

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
NA

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
Yes
